description: The function 'draw_fractional_models_multiplication_units' is designed to create a visual representation of the multiplication of fractions. It takes two fractions as input and generates a rectangular grid. The dimensions of the grid are determined by the denominators of the fractions, and the shaded area represents the product of the fractions. The grid is divided into smaller rectangles, each representing a unit fraction. The function uses the matplotlib library to create the visualization.

parameters.name: model_data
parameters.description: This parameter represents the set of fractions to be multiplied. It is an object of the FractionSet class, which contains a list of fractions.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: draw_fractional_models_multiplication_units
stimulus_type_specification.description: The images depict a rectangular grid representing the multiplication of two fractions. The dimensions of the grid are determined by the denominators of the fractions, and the shaded area represents the product of the fractions. Each small rectangle in the grid represents a unit fraction.

details: The grid is a rectangle with dimensions determined by the denominators of the fractions.
Each small rectangle in the grid represents a unit fraction.
The shaded area represents the product of the fractions.
The position of the shaded area is determined by the numerators of the fractions.

stimulus_type_specification.educational_purpose: The images serve as a visual aid for understanding the concept of multiplication of fractions. They can be used in classroom instruction or in self-study materials to help students visualize and better understand this concept.
